<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	following the year in which the Participant becomes age 65, as elected by the Participant in the Enrollment Agreement pursuant to which such Retirement Distribution Account was established or
	otherwise as permitted under Section 7.1(a).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	6.3&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution
	Option
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to Section&nbsp;7.2, the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account shall be distributed commencing in the Plan Year elected by the Participant in the Enrollment
	Agreement pursuant to which such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account was established. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Participant shall not be entitled to allocate any Bonus Compensation Deferrals to an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account for the two Plan Years preceding the Plan Year which includes the date on which the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account is to be distributed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 7
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	BENEFITS TO PARTICIPANTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Benefits Under the Retirement Distribution Option
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits under the Retirement Distribution Option shall be paid to a
	Participant as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Benefits Upon Retirement
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant whose Service with the Company
	terminates on account of Retirement, the Participant&#146;s Retirement Distribution Account shall be distributed pursuant to one of the following methods, as elected by the Participant in writing either in the Enrollment Agreement or in a separate
	election made as provided below: (i)&nbsp;in a lump sum; or (ii)&nbsp;in up to 5 annual installments. Payments shall commence in accordance with the Participant&#146;s election pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.2. Any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	lump-sum
</FONT>
	benefit payable in accordance with this paragraph shall be paid in an amount equal to the value of such Retirement Distribution Account as of the last business day of the Plan Year preceding the date
	of payment. If annual installments are elected in accordance with this paragraph, the amount of the first annual installment payment shall equal (i)&nbsp;the value of such Retirement Distribution Account as of the last business day of the Plan Year
	preceding the date of payment, divided by (ii)&nbsp;the number of annual installment payments elected by the Participant. The remaining annual installments shall be paid not later than January&nbsp;31 of each succeeding Plan Year in an amount equal
	to (i)&nbsp;the value of such Retirement Distribution Account as of the last business day of the immediately preceding Plan Year divided by (ii)&nbsp;the number of installments remaining. A Participant may change the election regarding the manner of
	payment of the Participant&#146;s Account, as described in Section&nbsp;6.1, at any time prior to the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the date of Retirement or (ii)&nbsp;June&nbsp;30 of the Plan Year in which occurs the Participant&#146;s Retirement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Benefits Upon Termination of Employment
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant whose Service with the Company terminates prior
	to the earliest date on which the Participant is eligible for Retirement, other than by reason of death, a Participant&#146;s Retirement Distribution Account shall be distributed in lump sum on (i)&nbsp;the January&nbsp;31 following the
	Participant&#146;s Termination Date or (ii)&nbsp;such other date as is mutually agreed upon by the Company and the Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	7.2&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Benefits Under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Option
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Option shall be paid to a Participant as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distributions
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant who continues in Service with the Company, the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account shall
	be paid to the Participant commencing on January&nbsp;31 of the Plan Year irrevocably elected by the Participant in the Enrollment Agreement pursuant to which such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account was
	established, which may be no earlier than the third Plan Year following the end of the last Plan
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Appendix A Page A-7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Year in which Bonus Compensation Deferrals are to be credited to that
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account, in one lump sum or in annual installments payable
	over 2, 3, or 4 years. Any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	lump-sum
</FONT>
	benefit payable in accordance with this paragraph shall be paid on January&nbsp;31 of the Plan Year elected by the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.3, in an
	amount equal to the value of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the last business day of the Plan Year preceding the date of payment. Annual installment payments, if any, shall commence not later than
	January&nbsp;31 of the Plan Year as elected by the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.3, in an amount equal to (i)&nbsp;the value of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the last business day
	of the Plan Year preceding the date of payment, divided by (ii)&nbsp;the number of annual installment payments elected by the Participant in the Enrollment Agreement pursuant to which such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account was established. The remaining annual installments shall be paid not later than January&nbsp;31 of each succeeding Plan Year in an amount equal to (i)&nbsp;the value of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the last business day of the immediately preceding Plan Year divided by (ii)&nbsp;the number of installments remaining.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Benefits Upon Termination of Employment
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant whose Service with the Company terminates prior
	to the date on which the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account would otherwise be distributed, other than by reason of death, such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution
	Account shall be distributed in a lump sum (i)&nbsp;on January&nbsp;31 following the Participant&#146;s Termination Date; or (ii)&nbsp;such other date as is mutually agreed upon by the Company and the Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 8
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	SURVIVOR BENEFITS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Death of Participant Prior to the Commencement of Benefits
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a Participant&#146;s death prior to the
	commencement of benefits in accordance with Article 7, benefits shall be paid to the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary, as determined under Section&nbsp;12.3, pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.2 or 8.3, whichever is applicable, in lieu of any benefits
	otherwise payable under the Plan to or on behalf of such Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Survivor Benefits Under the Retirement Distribution
	Option
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant with respect to whom the Company has established a Retirement Distribution Account, and who dies prior to the commencement of benefits under such Retirement Distribution Account pursuant to
	Section&nbsp;7.1, distribution of such Retirement Distribution Account shall be made in a lump sum (a)&nbsp;as soon as practicable following the Participant&#146;s death, or (b)&nbsp;such other date as is mutually agreed upon by the Company and the
	Beneficiary. The amount of any lump sum benefit payable in accordance with this Section shall equal the value of such Retirement Distribution Account as of the last business day of
<I>
</I>
	the calendar month immediately preceding the date on which
	such benefit is paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	8.3&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Survivor Benefits Under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution
	Option
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a Participant with respect to whom the Company has established an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account, and who dies prior to the date on which such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account is to be paid pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.2, distribution of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account shall be made in a lump sum (a)&nbsp;as soon
	as practicable following the Participant&#146;s death, or (b)&nbsp;such other date as is mutually agreed upon by the Company and the Beneficiary. The amount of any lump sum benefit payable in accordance with this Section shall equal the value of
	such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the last business day of the calendar month immediately preceding the date on which such benefit is paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Appendix A Page A-8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	8.4&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Death of Participant After Benefits Have Commenced
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event a
	Participant dies after annual installment benefits payable under Section&nbsp;7.1 or 7.2 from the Participant&#146;s Accounts has commenced, but before the entire balance of any such Account has been paid, any remaining installments shall be paid in
	lump sum (a)&nbsp;as soon as practicable following the Participant&#146;s death, or (b)&nbsp;such other date as is mutually agreed upon by the Company and the Beneficiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 9
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EMERGENCY BENEFIT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the event that the Committee, upon written request of a Participant, determines, in its sole discretion, that the Participant has suffered an
	unforeseeable financial emergency, the Company shall pay to the Participant from the Participant&#146;s Distribution Option Account, as soon as practicable following such determination, an amount necessary to meet the emergency, after deduction of
	any and all taxes as may be required pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.9 (the &#147;Emergency Benefit&#148;). For purposes of this Plan, an unforeseeable financial emergency is an unexpected need for cash arising from an illness, casualty loss, sudden
	financial reversal, or other such unforeseeable occurrence. Cash needs arising from foreseeable events such as the purchase of a house or education expenses for children shall not be considered to be the result of an unforeseeable financial
	emergency. Emergency Benefits shall be paid first from the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account, if any, to the extent the balance of such
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account is sufficient to meet the emergency. If the distribution exhausts the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account, the Retirement Distribution Account may be accessed. With respect to that portion of
	any Distribution Option Account which is distributed to a Participant as an Emergency Benefit, in accordance with this Article, no further benefit shall be payable to the Participant under this Plan. Notwithstanding anything in this Plan to the
	contrary, a Participant who receives an Emergency Benefit in any Plan Year shall not be entitled to make any further deferrals for the remainder of such Plan Year. It is intended that the Committee&#146;s determination as to whether a Participant
	has suffered an &#147;unforeseeable financial emergency&#148; shall be made consistent with the requirements under section&nbsp;457(d) of the Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 10
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ACCELERATED DISTRIBUTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.1&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Availability of Withdrawal Prior to Retirement
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the Participant&#146;s written election, the Participant
	may elect to withdraw all or a portion of the Participant&#146;s Distribution Option Account at any time prior to the time such Distribution Option Account otherwise becomes payable under the Plan, provided the conditions specified in
	Section&nbsp;10.3, Section&nbsp;10.4, and Section&nbsp;10.5 are satisfied.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.2&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Acceleration of Periodic
	Distributions
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the Participant&#146;s written election, the Participant or Participant&#146;s Beneficiary who is receiving installment payments under the Plan may elect to have all or a percentage of the remaining installments
	distributed in the form of an immediately payable lump sum, provided the condition specified in Section&nbsp;10.3 is satisfied.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.3&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Forfeiture Penalty
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a withdrawal pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.1, or an accelerated distribution
	pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.2, the Participant shall forfeit from his Distribution Option Account from which the withdrawal is made an amount equal to 10% of the amount of the withdrawal or accelerated distribution, as the case may be. The forfeited
	amount shall be deducted from the applicable Distribution Option Account prior to giving effect to the requested withdrawal or acceleration. The Participant and the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary shall not have any
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Appendix A Page A-9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	right or claim to the forfeited amount, and the Company shall have no obligation whatsoever to the Participant, the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary or any other person with regard to the forfeited
	amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.4&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Minimum Withdrawal
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In no event shall the amount withdrawn in accordance with Section&nbsp;10.1 be less
	than 25% of the amount credited to the Participant&#146;s Distribution Option Account immediately prior to the withdrawal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.5&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Suspension from Deferrals
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a withdrawal pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.1, a Participant who is otherwise
	eligible to make deferrals under Article 4 shall be prohibited from making any deferrals with respect to the Plan Year immediately following the Plan Year during which the withdrawal was made, and any election previously made by the Participant with
	respect to deferrals for the Plan Year of the withdrawal shall be void and of no effect with respect to subsequent deferrals for such Plan Year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 11
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHANGE OF CONTROL
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the case of a Change of Control, a Participant may make a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-time
</FONT>
	irrevocable election, within 60 days after
	the closing of the transaction pursuant to which the Change of Control was occasioned, to receive the full amount credited to the Participant&#146;s Retirement Distribution Account and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution
	Account in a lump sum. Any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	lump-sum
</FONT>
	benefit payable in accordance with this paragraph shall be paid in, but not later than January&nbsp;31 of, the Plan Year following the Plan Year in which such closing
	occurs, in an amount equal to the value of such Retirement Distribution Account and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the last business day of the Plan Year preceding the date of payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 12
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MISCELLANEOUS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.1&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Amendment and Termination
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan may be amended, suspended, discontinued or terminated at any time by the Board;
	provided, however, that no such amendment, suspension, discontinuance or termination shall reduce or in any manner adversely affect the rights of any Participant with respect to benefits that are payable or may become payable under the Plan based
	upon the balance of the Participant&#146;s Retirement Account and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Distribution Account as of the effective date of such amendment, suspension, discontinuance or termination.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.2
<U>
	Claims Procedure
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	a.&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Claim
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A person who believes
	that he is being denied a benefit to which he is entitled under the Plan (hereinafter referred to as a &#147;Claimant&#148;) may file a written request for such benefit with the Committee, setting forth the claim.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	b.&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Claim Decision
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Upon receipt
	of a claim, the Committee shall advise the Claimant that a reply will be forthcoming within ninety (90)&nbsp;days and shall, in fact, deliver such reply within such period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Appendix A Page A-10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Committee may, however, extend the reply period for an additional ninety (90)&nbsp;days for reasonable cause.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If the claim is denied in whole or in part, the Claimant shall be provided a written opinion, using language calculated to be understood by the
	Claimant, setting forth:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;The specific reason or reasons for such denial;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;The specific reference to pertinent provisions of this Agreement on which such denial is based;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;A description of any additional material or information necessary for the Claimant to perfect his claim and an explanation why such
	material or such information is necessary;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Appropriate information as to the steps to be taken if the Claimant wishes to submit the
	claim for review; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;The time limits for requesting a review under subsection (c)&nbsp;and for review under subsection
	(d)&nbsp;hereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	c.&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Request for Review
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the receipt by the Claimant of the written opinion described above, the Claimant may request in writing that the
	Committee review the determination. The Claimant or his duly authorized representative may, but need not, review the pertinent documents and submit issues and comment in writing for consideration by the Committee. If the Claimant does not request a
	review of the initial determination within such sixty (60)&nbsp;day period, the Claimant shall be barred and estopped from challenging the determination.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	d.&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Review of Decision
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:15%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Within
	sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the Committee&#146;s receipt of a request for review, it will review the initial determination. After considering all materials presented by the Claimant, the Committee will render a written opinion, written in a manner
	calculated to be understood by the Claimant, setting forth the specific reasons for the decision and containing specific references to the pertinent provisions of this Agreement on which the decision is based. If special circumstances require that
	the sixty (60)&nbsp;day time period be extended, the Committee will so notify the Claimant and will render the decision as soon as possible, but no later than one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;days after receipt of the request for review.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.3&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Designation of Beneficiary
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Participant may designate a Beneficiary or Beneficiaries (which Beneficiary may be an
	entity other than a natural person) to receive any payments which may be made following the Participant&#146;s death. Such designation may be changed or canceled at any time without the consent of any such Beneficiary. Any such designation, change
	or cancellation must be made in a form approved by the Committee and shall not be effective until received by the Committee, or its designee. If no Beneficiary has been named, or the designated Beneficiary or Beneficiaries shall have predeceased the
	Participant, the Beneficiary shall be the Participant&#146; s estate. If a Participant designates more than one Beneficiary, the interests of such Beneficiaries shall be paid in equal shares, unless the Participant has specifically designated
	otherwise.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.4&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Limitation of Participant&#146;s Right
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing in this Plan shall be construed as
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Appendix A Page A-11&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	conferring upon any Participant any right to continue in the employment of the Company, nor shall it interfere with the rights of the Company to terminate the employment of any Participant and/or
	to take any personnel action affecting any Participant without regard to the effect which such action may have upon such Participant as a recipient or prospective recipient of benefits under the Plan. Any amounts payable hereunder shall not be
	deemed salary or other compensation to a Participant for the purposes of computing benefits to which the Participant may be entitled under any other arrangement established by the Company for the benefit of its employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.5&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	No Limitation on Company Actions
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing contained in the Plan shall be construed to prevent the Company from taking
	any action which is deemed by it to be appropriate or in its best interest. No Participant, Beneficiary, or other person shall have any claim against the Company as a result of such action.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.6&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Obligations to Company
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant becomes entitled to a distribution of benefits under the Plan, and if at such
	time the Participant has outstanding any debt, obligation, or other liability representing an amount owing to the Company under a legally binding written instrument, then the Company may offset such amount owed to it against the amount of benefits
	otherwise distributable. Such determination shall be made by the Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.7&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Nonalienation of Benefits
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as
	expressly provided herein, no Participant or Beneficiary shall have the power or right to transfer (otherwise than by will or the laws of descent and distribution), alienate, or otherwise encumber the Participant&#146;s interest under the Plan. The
	Company&#146;s obligations under this Plan are not assignable or transferable except to (a)&nbsp;any corporation or partnership which acquires all or substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets or (b)&nbsp;any corporation or partnership into
	which the Company may be merged or consolidated. The provisions of the Plan shall inure to the benefit of each Participant and the Participant&#146;s Beneficiaries, heirs, executors, administrators or successors in interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.8&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Withholding Taxes
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may make such provisions and take such action as it may deem necessary or appropriate
	for the withholding of any taxes which the Company is required by any law or regulation of any governmental authority, whether Federal, state or local, to withhold in connection with any benefits under the Plan, including, but not limited to, the
	withholding of appropriate sums from any amount otherwise payable to the Participant (or his Beneficiary). Each Participant, however, shall be responsible for the payment of all individual tax liabilities relating to any such benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.9&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Unfunded Status of Plan
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan is intended to constitute an &#147;unfunded&#148; plan of deferred compensation for
	Participants. Benefits payable hereunder shall be payable out of the general assets of the Company, and no segregation of any assets whatsoever for such benefits shall be made. Notwithstanding any segregation of assets or transfer to a grantor
	trust, with respect to any payments not yet made to a Participant, nothing contained herein shall give any such Participant any rights to assets that are greater than those of a general creditor of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.10&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Severability
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;If any provision of this Plan is held unenforceable, the remainder of the Plan shall continue in full
	force and effect without regard to such unenforceable provision and shall be applied as though the unenforceable provision were not contained in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.11&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Governing Law
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws of the Commonwealth of
	Pennsylvania, without reference to the principles of conflict of laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., Deferred Compensation Plan
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">

<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.12&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Headings
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Headings are inserted in this Plan for convenience of
	reference only and are to be ignored in the construction of the provisions of the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.13&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Gender, Singular and
	Plural
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;All pronouns and any variations thereof shall be deemed to refer to the masculine, feminine, or neuter, as the identity of the person or persons may require. As the context may require, the singular may read as the plural and
	the plural as the singular.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.14&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Notice
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any notice or filing required or permitted to be given to the Committee
	under the Plan shall be sufficient if in writing and hand delivered, or sent by registered or certified mail, to the Human Resources Department, or to such other entity as the Committee may designate from time to time. Such notice shall be deemed
	given as to the date of delivery, or, if delivery is made by mail, as of the date shown on the postmark on the receipt for registration or certification.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	1.01&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.30EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Purpose
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:3.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	1.02&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.30EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Effective Date
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	1

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2">

<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="4">
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	ARTICLE&nbsp;2&nbsp;.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	DEFINITIONS AND CONSTRUCTION
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	2
</B>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:3.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	2.01&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc. Supplemental Senior Executive Death Benefit Plan

<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;PURPOSE AND EFFECTIVE DATE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Purpose.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	This AMETEK, Inc. Supplemental Senior Executive Death Benefit Plan (the
	&#147;Plan&#148;) is intended to provide an additional benefit to certain senior executives of AMETEK, Inc., and its subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;), either in the form of a Retirement Benefit (as set forth in Article 4) or in the form of a
	Death Benefit (as set forth in Article 5), but not both. If a Participant retires from the Company after attaining early or normal retirement eligibility (or retires from the Company due to disability before attaining normal retirement eligibility
	and then attains normal retirement age), he will receive a Retirement Benefit determined in accordance with Article 4 of the Plan. In contrast, if a Participant dies while actively employed by the Company and is otherwise eligible to participate in
	the Plan (or after retiring due to disability but before attaining eligibility for normal retirement), his Beneficiary(ies) will receive a Death Benefit determined in accordance with Article 5 of the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Retirement Benefit and the Death Benefit are mutually exclusive: no Death Benefit will be paid on behalf of a Participant who receives a Retirement
	Benefit, and no Retirement Benefit will be paid on behalf of a Participant if a Death Benefit is paid on that Participant&#146;s behalf. A Participant who terminates employment (not on account of his death or disability) before attaining early or
	normal retirement eligibility will not receive any benefit under the Plan and no Plan benefit will be paid on his behalf.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effective Date.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	The Plan, as hereby amended and restated, is effective January&nbsp;1, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	This Plan restatement is effective with respect to the entire benefit of a Participant if the Participant Separates from Service after December&nbsp;31, 2004.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	If a Participant Separated from Service before January&nbsp;1, 2005, and had not received his entire benefit as of that date, the Participant&#146;s Retirement Benefit and Death Benefit shall be subject to the
	terms of this restatement, except that the maximum Retirement Benefit amount under Section&nbsp;4.02(b) and the maximum Death Benefit amount under Section 5.02(b) shall equal the maximum amounts set forth in paragraphs Second and First,
	respectively, of the Participant&#146;s participation agreement under the 1992 restatement of the Plan, as amended. These changes are permitted under the terms of the 1992 restatement of the Plan because they are being made to all participation
	agreements and do not reduce the value of a Participant&#146;s Retirement Benefit or Death Benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	This amendment and restatement of the Plan is not intended to constitute a &#147;material modification&#148; for purposes of section 409A of the Code with respect to the benefit of a Participant (and earnings on
	such benefit), which was earned and vested (within the meaning of section 409A of the Code) before January&nbsp;1, 2005. However, the Company shall not be liable for any adverse tax consequence suffered by a Participant or Beneficiary if a
	Participant&#146;s benefit becomes subject to section 409A of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc. Supplemental Senior Executive Death Benefit Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 1&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;DEFINITIONS AND CONSTRUCTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Definitions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As used in the Plan, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning set
	forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Annual Salary
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Annual Salary&#148; means a Participant&#146;s salary, not including bonuses or imputed income, paid by the Company for a calendar year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Beneficiary
</U>
</B>
	.
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Beneficiary&#148; means the person, persons or entity as designated by the Participant, entitled under Article 7 to receive any Plan benefits payable after the
	Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Board
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Board&#148; means the Board of Directors of AMETEK, Inc.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
<B>
	Change in Control
</B>
</U>
<U>
	.
</U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;A &#147;Change in Control&#148; shall occur if:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any one person or more than one person acting as a group (as defined in section
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires ownership of stock of the Company that,
	together with the stock held by such person or group of persons, constitutes more than 50&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value or total voting power of the stock of the Company. However, if such person or group of persons is considered to own
	more than 50&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value or total voting power of the stock of the Company before this transfer of the Company&#146;s stock, the acquisition of additional stock by the same person or group of persons shall not be
	considered to cause a Change in Control of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any one person or more than one person acting as a group (as defined in section
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires (or has acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such person or group of persons) ownership of stock of the Company possessing 30&nbsp;percent or more of the total voting power of the stock of
	the Company. However, if such person or group of persons is considered to own 30&nbsp;percent or more of the total voting power of the stock of the Company before this acquisition, the acquisition of additional control or stock of the Company by the
	same person or group of persons shall not cause a Change in Control of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A majority of members of the Company&#146;s Board is replaced during any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period by directors whose appointment or election is not endorsed by a majority of the members of
	the Company&#146;s Board before the date of the appointment or election; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
	Any one person or more than one person acting as a group (as defined in section
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires (or has acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such person
	or group of persons) assets from the Company that have a total gross fair market value equal to substantially all but in no event less than 40&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value of all
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">

<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	assets of the Company immediately prior to such acquisition or acquisitions. For this purpose, gross fair market value means the value of the assets of the Company, or the value of the assets
	being disposed of, determined without regard to any liabilities associated with such assets. A transfer of assets by the Company will not result in a Change in Control under this Section 2.01(d)(4), if the assets are transferred to:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A shareholder of the Company (immediately before the asset transfer) in exchange for or with respect to its stock;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An entity, 50&nbsp;percent or more of the total value or voting power of which is owned, directly or indirectly, by the Company immediately after the transfer of assets;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A person or more than one person acting as a group (as defined in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	section&nbsp;1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) that owns, directly or indirectly, 50&nbsp;percent
	or more of the total value or voting power of all the outstanding stock of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(D)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An entity, at least 50&nbsp;percent of the total value or voting power of which is owned directly or indirectly, by a person described in Section 2.01(d)(4)(C), above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of this Section 2.01(d), no acquisition, either directly or indirectly, by the Participant, his affiliates and associates, the Company,
	any subsidiary of the Company, any employee benefit plan of the Company or of any subsidiary of the Company, or any person or entity organized, appointed or established by the Company for or pursuant to the terms of any such employee benefit plan
	shall constitute a Change in Control.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>
<U>
	Code
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Code&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Committee&#148; means the Committee appointed by the Board (or its delegee) to administer the Plan pursuant to Article 8.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	Company
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Company&#148; means AMETEK, Inc., a Delaware corporation.

</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Death Benefit
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Death Benefit&#148; means the benefit paid on behalf of a Participant in accordance with Article 5.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Deferred Retirement
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Deferred Retirement&#148; means Separation from Service by the Participant after attaining age 70.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(j)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Disability
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Disability&#148; means a medically determinable physical or mental
	impairment which can be expected to result in death or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than twelve (12)&nbsp;months that (1)&nbsp;renders a Participant unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity or
	(2)&nbsp;results in a Participant receiving income replacement benefits for a period of not less than three (3)&nbsp;months under an accident and health plan covering employees of the Company. The Committee shall determine the existence of
	Disability, in its sole discretion, and may rely on advice from a medical examiner satisfactory to the
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Committee in making the determination. A Participant will also be considered disabled if he has been determined to be totally disabled by the Social Security Administration. The term
	&#147;Disability&#148; is intended to comply with section 409A(a)(2)(C) of the Code and shall be interpreted to permit a Participant to take a distribution in any circumstance that would be permitted under section 409A(a)(2)(C) of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<B>
	(k)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Early Retirement
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Early Retirement&#148; means Separation from Service by the Participant after attaining age fifty-five (55)&nbsp;with at least five (5)&nbsp;Years of Service and
	before attaining age sixty-five (65).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<U>
	Effective Date
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Effective Date&#148; means January&nbsp;1, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</B>

<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Eligible Executive
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Eligible Executive&#148; means an Employee in the select group of management or highly compensated senior executives of the Company whom the Board designates as
	eligible to participate in the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Employee
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Employee&#148; means any individual, except any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-resident
</FONT>
	alien, employed on a regular basis by the Company; provided, however,
	that any leased employee within the meaning of section 414(n)(2) of the Code shall not be included.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</U>

	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;ERISA&#148; means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(p)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Normal Retirement
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Normal Retirement&#148; means Separation from Service by the Participant on or after attaining age sixty-five (65)&nbsp;and before attaining age seventy (70).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(q)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Optional Form
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Optional Form&#148; means one of the following forms of payment:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Lump Sum
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Optional Form is payable in one lump sum on the commencement date specified in Section 6.01(a)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Installments.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;This Optional Form of benefit is payable monthly to the Participant for the number of periods designated by the Participant. A Participant may not elect a number of installment payments
	that results in payments being made beyond the date on which the Participant attains age 85.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Life Annuity
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Optional Form of benefit is payable monthly to the Participant for life.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Life Annuity with 120 or 60 Payments Guaranteed
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Optional Form of benefit is payable monthly to the Participant for life with the first one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;or sixty (60)&nbsp;monthly
	payment guaranteed, as elected by the Participant. A Participant may not elect a period of guaranteed payments that exceeds the Participant&#146;s remaining life expectancy at the time of the election.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(r)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Participant
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Participant&#148; means any Eligible Executive who is eligible and has become a participant pursuant to Article 3. Such employee shall remain a Participant in this Plan
	until such time as all benefits payable under this Plan have been paid in accordance with the provisions hereof.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Participation Agreement
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Participation Agreement&#148; shall mean any of the agreements entered into by the Company and any Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.02.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(t)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Plan
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Plan&#148; means the AMETEK, Inc. Supplemental Senior Executive Death Benefit Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(u)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Plan Year
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Plan Year&#148; means the calendar year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(v)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Retirement Benefit
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Retirement Benefit&#148; means the benefit payable to a Participant at Early Retirement, Normal Retirement or Deferred Retirement under Article 4.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(w)
</B>
<B>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Separation from Service
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Separation from Service&#148; or &#147;Separates from Service&#148; means separation from service within the meaning of section 409A of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(x)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Year of Service
</U>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Year of Service&#148; means the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period following the date that the Participant first performs an hour of service for the
	Company and each consecutive
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period following the anniversary of that date that is completed before the Participant Separates from Service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Construction.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of the Plan, unless the contrary is clearly indicated by the context,
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the use of the masculine gender shall also include within its meaning the feminine and vice versa,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the use of the singular shall also include within its meaning the plural and vice versa, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the word &#147;include&#148; shall mean to include without limitation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>

</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc. Supplemental Senior Executive Death Benefit Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Page 5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
