<A NAME="eolPage172"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;PURPOSE AND EFFECTIVE DATE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Purpose.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	This AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) is intended
	to provide an additional benefit to a select group of management and highly compensated employees of AMETEK, Inc., and certain of its subsidiaries, either in the form of a Retirement Benefit (as set forth in Article 4) or in the form of a Death
	Benefit (as set forth in Article 5), but not both. If a Participant retires from the Company after attaining early or normal retirement eligibility, he will receive a Retirement Benefit equal to the value of an Account maintained for the Participant
	under the Plan. In contrast, if a Participant dies while actively employed by the Company and otherwise eligible to participate in the Plan (or after suffering a disability but before attaining eligibility for normal retirement), his
	Beneficiary(ies) will receive a Death Benefit in the form of fixed monthly installment payments until the month during which the Participant would have attained age 80.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Retirement Benefit and the Death Benefit are mutually exclusive: no Death Benefit will be paid on behalf of a Participant who receives a Retirement
	Benefit, and no Retirement Benefit will be paid on behalf of a Participant if a Death Benefit is paid on that Participant&#146;s behalf. A Participant who Separates from Service (not on account of his death or Disability) before attaining early or
	normal retirement eligibility will not receive any benefit under the Plan and no Plan benefit will be paid on his behalf, unless the Participant is involuntarily terminated within two years following a Change in Control of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effective Date.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Plan is effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2004, although this amendment and
	restatement is effective January&nbsp;1, 2017. Because no benefits under the Plan were vested as of December&nbsp;31, 2004, no benefits under the Plan are treated as grandfathered for purposes of section 409A of the Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 1&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;DEFINITIONS AND CONSTRUCTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Definitions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the purpose of this Plan, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth
	below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Account
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Account&#148; means the hypothetical account maintained on the books of the Company, used solely to calculate the Retirement Benefit payable to each Participant under this
	Plan, as set forth in Section&nbsp;4.02.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Article
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Article&#148; means an article of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Beneficiary
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Beneficiary&#148; means the person, persons or entity as designated by the Participant, entitled under Article 7 to receive any Plan benefits payable after the
	Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Board
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Board&#148; means the Board of Directors of AMETEK, Inc.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(e)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Change in Control
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A &#147;Change in Control&#148; shall occur if:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any one Person or more than one Person acting as a group (as defined in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	section&nbsp;1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires ownership of stock of the Company
	that, together with the stock held by such Person or group of Persons, constitutes more than 50&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value or total voting power of the stock of the Company. However, if such Person or group of Persons is considered
	to own more than 50&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value or total voting power of the stock of the Company before this transfer of the Company&#146;s stock, the acquisition of additional stock by the same Person or group of Persons shall not
	be considered to cause a Change in Control of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any one Person or more than one Person acting as a group (as defined in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	section&nbsp;1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires (or has acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such Person or group of Persons) ownership of stock of the Company possessing 30&nbsp;percent or more of the total voting power of the stock of
	the Company. However, if such Person or group of Persons is considered to own 30&nbsp;percent or more of the total voting power of the stock of the Company before this acquisition, the acquisition of additional control or stock of the Company by the
	same Person or group of Persons shall not cause a Change in Control of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">

</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A majority of members of the Company&#146;s Board is replaced during any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period by directors whose appointment or election is not endorsed by a majority of the members of
	the Company&#146;s Board before the date of the appointment or election; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any one Person or more than one Person acting as a group (as defined in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	section&nbsp;1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) acquires (or has acquired during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such Person or group of Persons) assets from the Company that have a total gross fair market value equal to substantially all but in no event less
	than 40&nbsp;percent of the total fair market value of all assets of the Company immediately prior to such acquisition or acquisitions. For this purpose, gross fair market value means the value of the assets of the Company, or the value of the
	assets being disposed of, determined without regard to any liabilities associated with such assets. A transfer of assets by the Company will not result in a Change in Control under this Section 2.01(e)(4), if the assets are transferred to:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A shareholder of the Company (immediately before the asset transfer) in exchange for or with respect to its stock;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An entity, 50&nbsp;percent or more of the total value or voting power of which is owned, directly or indirectly, by the Company immediately after the transfer of assets;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Person or more than one Person acting as a group (as defined in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	section&nbsp;1.409A-3(i)(5)(v)(B)
</FONT>
	of the Treasury Regulations) that owns, directly or indirectly, 50&nbsp;percent
	or more of the total value or voting power of all the outstanding stock of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(D)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An entity, at least 50&nbsp;percent of the total value or voting power of which is owned directly or indirectly, by a person of group of persons described in Section 2.01(e)(4)(C), above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of this Section 2.01(e), no acquisition, either directly or indirectly, by the Participant, his affiliates and associates, the Company,
	any subsidiary of the Company, any employee benefit plan of the Company or of any subsidiary of the Company, or any person or entity organized, appointed or established by the Company for or pursuant to the terms of any such employee benefit plan
	shall constitute a Change in Control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of this Section 2.01(e), the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#147;Company&#148; shall mean AMETEK, Inc., except that, if a Participant is employed by a majority-controlled subsidiary of the Company, for purposes of Sections 2.01(e)(1), 2.01(e)(2), and 2.01(e)(4),
	&#147;Company&#148; shall mean such subsidiary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 3&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#147;Person&#148; shall mean any individual or individuals other than the Participant, his affiliates and associates, the Company, any subsidiary of the Company, any employee benefit plan of the Company or of any
	subsidiary of the Company, or any person or entity organized, appointed or established by the Company for or pursuant to the terms of any such employee benefit plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(f)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Code
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Code&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(g)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Committee
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Committee&#148; means the Committee appointed by the Board (or its delegee) to administer the Plan pursuant to Article 8.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(h)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Company
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Company&#148; means AMETEK, Inc., a Delaware corporation, and any directly or indirectly affiliated subsidiary corporations, any other affiliate designated by the Board, or
	any successor to the business of any such entity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Death Benefit
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Death Benefit&#148; means the benefit paid on behalf of a Participant in accordance with Article 5.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(j)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Determination Date
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Determination Date&#148; means the last business day of each Plan Year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(k)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Disability
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Disability&#148; means a medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or can be expected to last for a continuous period
	of not less than twelve (12)&nbsp;months that (1)&nbsp;renders a Participant unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity or (2)&nbsp;results in a Participant receiving income replacement benefits for a period of not less than three
	(3)&nbsp;months under an accident and health plan covering employees of the Company. The Committee shall determine the existence of Disability, in its sole discretion, and may rely on advice from a medical examiner satisfactory to the Committee in
	making the determination. A Participant will also be considered disabled if he has been determined to be totally disabled by the Social Security Administration. The term &#147;Disability&#148; is intended to comply with section 409A(a)(2)(C) of the
	Code and shall be interpreted to permit a Participant to take a distribution in any circumstance that would be permitted under section 409A(a)(2)(C) of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(l)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Early Retirement
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Early Retirement&#148; means the Separation from Service with the Company by the Participant after attaining age fifty-five (55)&nbsp;with at least five
	(5)&nbsp;Years of Service and before attaining age sixty-five (65).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</U>

	&#147;ERISA&#148; means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Life Insurance Policies
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Life Insurance Policies&#148; means the life insurance
	policies maintained by the Company for the purpose of measuring the Retirement Benefits, if any, payable under this Plan. Such Life Insurance Policies shall be owned by and payable to the Company; the Participants shall have no rights or interest in
	the Policies or any benefits from the Policies, even if a Policy is payable
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	upon the death of the Participant. The Life Insurance Policies shall be used solely as method to measure the Retirement Benefits, if any, payable under this Plan, and the Participants shall have
	no greater interest in any benefit under this Plan than that of an unsecured creditor of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	Limited Participant
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Limited Participant&#148; means a Participant whose benefits under the Plan are limited pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.02 after the Committee determines that
	the Participant&#146;s employment position is no longer at a level that warrants full participation in the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</U>
</B>

	determined by the Board in its sole discretion.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Year of Service
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Year of Service&#148; means the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period following the date that the Participant first performs an hour of
	service for the Company and each consecutive
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period following the anniversary of that date that is completed before the Participant Separates from Service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

	For purposes of the Plan, unless the contrary is clearly indicated by the context,
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>
	the use of the masculine gender shall also include within its meaning the feminine and vice versa,
</TD>
</TR>

	&nbsp;
</P>

	the use of the singular shall also include within its meaning the plural and vice versa, and
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage177"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 3.&nbsp;&nbsp;ELIGIBILITY AND PARTICIPATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Eligibility and Participation.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Eligibility to participate in the Plan shall be limited to that
	select group of management and/or highly compensated employees of the Company whom the Committee designated as eligible to participate in the Plan as of January&nbsp;1, 2004. Eligibility and participation shall be frozen to new participants after
	that date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Change in Employment Status.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If the Committee determines that a Participant&#146;s position is
	no longer at a level that warrants reward through participation in this Plan, but does not terminate the Participant&#146;s employment with Company, the Participant shall become a Limited Participant whose benefits under this Plan shall be limited
	to the Account balance as of the date so specified by the Committee, which shall be adjusted each subsequent year that the Participant remains an active employee of the Company (and does not again become employed in a position that warrants full
	participation in the Plan) by the lesser of (a)&nbsp;the amount of the Annual Allocation that the Participant would have received had he remained in his former position or (b)&nbsp;the interest that the Participant would have received had he
	terminated his employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If the Committee determines that a Participant&#146;s position has risen to a level that warrants additional reward
	under the Plan, the Committee may, in its sole discretion, adjust the Participant&#146;s benefits under this Plan pursuant to Section 4.02(a)(1) by increasing the Participant&#146;s Percentage Allocation for that Plan Year and any subsequent year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If the Committee, in its sole discretion, determines that the Participant no longer qualifies as a member of a select group of management or highly
	compensated employees, as determined in accordance with ERISA, the Committee may, in its sole discretion, take such action as it deems necessary to preserve the status of the Plan as a &#147;top hat&#148; plan under ERISA.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 6&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage178"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 4.&nbsp;&nbsp;RETIREMENT BENEFIT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Nature of Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant&#146;s Retirement Benefit under the Plan shall be equal to the
	value of an Account that shall be maintained for his benefit on the Company&#146;s records. A Participant&#146;s Account shall be only hypothetical in nature, and nothing in this Plan shall be construed to grant any rights or interests in any asset
	of the Company, including the Life Insurance Policies, to any Participant. The Life Insurance Policies (even if payable on the death of the Participant) are used solely as a method to measure the Annual Allocations to be added to Participants&#146;
	accounts. The Participants shall at all times remain general, unsecured creditors of the Company with respect to the benefits payable under this Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Retirement Benefit under the Plan is mutually exclusive with the Death Benefit under the Plan (which is described in Article 5). No Retirement
	Benefit shall be paid to or on behalf of any Participant if a Death Benefit has been or will be paid on behalf of such Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Accounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company shall maintain a hypothetical account on behalf of each Participant in the
	Plan. The opening balance in each Participant&#146;s Account shall be zero dollars, and the balance in each Participant&#146;s Account shall increase or decrease each year as follows&#151;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Annual Allocations
</U>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Participant shall receive an Annual Allocation on each Determination Date on which the Participant is either (1)&nbsp;actively employed by the Company and otherwise
	eligible to participate in the Plan, (2)&nbsp;an inactive employee of the Company by reason of a Disability and not yet eligible for Normal Retirement, or (3)&nbsp;a former employee who terminated service with the Company under the Early or Normal
	Retirement provisions and has not yet had payments commence under this Plan. As provided in Section&nbsp;3.02, if the Participant is actively employed by the company as a Limited Participant, the Participant shall receive an Annual Allocation only
	if the amount of the Annual Allocation is less than the amount of interest he could receive pursuant to Section 4.02(b).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The amount
	of the Annual Allocation for each Participant entitled to receive an Annual Allocation shall be the product of the Participant&#146;s Percentage Allocation and the Aggregate Policy Gain for the Plan Year that ends on the applicable Determination
	Date. For this purpose&#151;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant&#146;s &#147;Percentage Allocation&#148; means the percentage identified for such Participant in a separate writing at the time he commences participation in the Plan. Once a Participant&#146;s Percentage
	Allocation is established, it shall not be changed unless the Participant is notified in writing that his Percentage Allocation is being changed because&#151;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant&#146;s employment responsibilities have changed such that an adjustment of the Participant&#146;s Percentage Allocation is warranted to reflect the Participant&#146;s new level of responsibilities; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 7&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage179"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the number of Participants in the Plan or the Life Insurance Policies have changed or are about to change in such a manner that it is necessary to modify the Participant&#146;s Percentage Allocation in order to maintain
	his level of benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:21%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If an individual ceases to be eligible to receive an Annual Addition (by reason of Separation from Service,
	death, or otherwise), his Percentage Allocation for all years
<I>
	after
</I>
	he ceases to be eligible to receive an Annual Addition shall revert to the Company and shall not be reallocated among some or all of the remaining Plan Participants unless
	the Committee determinates that a reallocation is appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The &#147;Aggregate Policy Gain&#148; for any given Plan Year means the sum of&#151;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the annual gains or losses on all of the Life Insurance Policies determined as of the most recent policy anniversary date of each of the Life Insurance Policies in accordance with FASB Technical Bulletin
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	85-4,
</FONT>
	and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any death benefits received by the Company from the Life Insurance Policies during the Plan Year, which are in excess of the sum of (1)&nbsp;and (2), minus (3)&nbsp;where:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	equals the greater of the premiums paid or the cash value of the Life Insurance Policy related to the deceased Participant as of the most recent Determination Date;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	equals the present value of the benefits to be received under this Plan by the deceased Participant&#146;s beneficiaries, as determined by the Committee in its sole discretion; and,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	equals the Account balance of the deceased Participant as of the most recent Determination Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:21%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(By
	way of example: if the anniversary date of a Life Insurance Policy is December 28th, the gain/loss on the policy will be determined as of each December 27th; the amount of that gain/loss shall be added to the gain/loss of all other listed policies
	to determine the Aggregate Policy Gain on December 31st, the end of the Plan Year. Such amount will then be used to determine the Annual Allocation as of December 31st. If, in that same year, a death benefit of $500,000 has been paid to the Company
	as a result of the death of an insured Participant, the cash value on that Participant&#146;s policy as of the most recent Determination Date was $100,000, the Participant&#146;s Account balance at that time was $50,000, and the Committee determines
	that, under the terms of this Plan, the beneficiaries of that Participant are entitled to a benefit of $300,000 on a present value basis, then $150,000 shall be included in the Aggregate Policy Gain.)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
<B>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Interest
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Participant shall receive interest on each Determination Date on
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 8&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage180"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	which he does not receive an Annual Allocation. The amount of interest for each such Participant shall be the product of the Participant&#146;s Account balance on the applicable Determination
	Date and the interest rate in effect under section 417(e) of the Code on such Determination Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<U>
	Distributions
</U>
</B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Account shall be reduced by the amount of each benefit payment made from that Account since the prior Determination Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.03.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Timing of Credits; Withholding.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Any Annual Allocations, interest, and distributions shall be
	credited to (or debited from) the appropriate Account at the time and as provided by the Committee. Any withholding of taxes or other amounts that is, in the discretion of the Committee, required by local, state or federal law shall be withheld from
	amounts otherwise payable to the Participant to the maximum extent possible, and any remaining amount shall reduce the amount credited to the Participant&#146;s Account in a manner specified by the Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.04.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Vesting of Accounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each Participant shall become 100% vested in his Account upon the earliest
	to occur of the following&#151;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	Separation from Service with the Company pursuant to either an Early Retirement or a Normal Retirement;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	dying while actively employed by the Company as a Limited Participant; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	incurring an involuntary Separation from Service from the Company for any reason within the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-year
</FONT>
	period immediately following a Change in Control.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant whose employment terminates for any reason before he has become 100% vested in his Account in accordance with this Section&nbsp;4.04
	(including the Participant&#146;s death while actively employed by the Company (as other than a Limited Participant) or while disabled and not yet eligible for Normal Retirement) shall forfeit his entire interest in his Account. If a Participant
	dies while actively employed by the Company, he shall receive a Death Benefit pursuant to Article 5, except that a Participant who dies while actively employed by the Company as a Limited Participant shall receive a Retirement Benefit pursuant to
	Section&nbsp;3.02 and not a Death Benefit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.05.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Statement of Accounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Committee shall give to each Participant a statement showing the
	balance in the Participant&#146;s Account on an annual basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 9&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage181"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;DEATH BENEFIT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Nature of Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant&#146;s Death Benefit under the Plan shall be a series of equal
	monthly installment payments that are payable if the Participant dies (a)&nbsp;while actively employed by the Company if the Participant is not a Limited Participant at the time of his death or (b)&nbsp;before reaching eligibility for Normal
	Retirement if the Participant has a Disability. A Participant&#146;s right to a Death Benefit shall not be construed to grant any rights or interests in any asset of the Company, including the Life Insurance Policies, to any Participant. The Life
	Insurance Policies (even if payable on the Participant&#146;s death) are used solely as a method to measure the Annual Allocations to be added to Participants&#146; Accounts for purposes of valuing their Retirement Benefits and have no relationship
	with the Death Benefit provided under the Plan. The Participants shall at all times remain general, unsecured creditors of the Company with respect to the benefits payable under this Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Death Benefit under the Plan is mutually exclusive with the Retirement Benefit under the Plan (as described in Article 4). No Death Benefit shall be
	paid on behalf of any Participant if a Retirement Benefit has been or will be paid to or on behalf of such Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Benefit Amounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Death Benefit payable upon the death of a Participant shall be a monthly
	benefit equal to either--
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	four thousand, one hundred
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	sixty-six
</FONT>
	dollars and sixty-seven cents ($4,166.67) per month, or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	eight thousand, three hundred thirty-three dollars and thirty-three cents ($8,333.33) per month,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	in each case, beginning in the month after the month during which the Participant dies and ending in the month during which the Participant would have
	attained age eighty (80). The amount of a Participant&#146;s Death Benefit shall be identified for the Participant in a separate writing at the time he commences participation in the Plan. Once the amount of a Participant&#146;s Death Benefit is
	established, it shall not be changed unless the Participant is notified in writing.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.03.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Vesting of Death Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each Participant shall become 100% vested in his Death Benefit upon
	his death (a)&nbsp;while actively employed by the Company if the Participant is not a Limited Participant at the time of his death or (b)&nbsp;before reaching eligibility for Normal Retirement if the Participant has a Disability.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.04.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Forfeiture.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<B>
</B>
	Any portion of a Participant&#146;s Death Benefit that does not vest in accordance with
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 10&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage182"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Section&nbsp;5.03 shall be forfeited on the date the Participant Separates from Service or dies, whichever occurs earlier, except that a Participant who has a Disability shall not forfeit his
	Death Benefit before Normal Retirement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	The Participant&#146;s entire Death Benefit shall be forfeited if a Retirement Benefit becomes payable to or on the behalf of the Participant in accordance with Article 4.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 11&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage183"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 6.&nbsp;&nbsp;PAYMENT OF PLAN BENEFITS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Timing of Benefit Payments.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Retirement Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Retirement.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	A Participant who Separates from Service with the Company pursuant to an Early Retirement or Normal Retirement shall receive his distribution on the first day of the month coincident with
	or next following the later of (A)&nbsp;the date that the Participant attains age sixty-five (65)&nbsp;or (B) the first date that is more than six (6)&nbsp;months after the date of the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service, provided that if the
	Participant dies after Separation from Service on or after attaining age 65 and before the date that is six (6)&nbsp;months after the date of the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service, the Retirement Benefit shall be paid on the first day of
	the month coincident with or next following the date of the Participant&#146;s death. The Participant may request a later distribution in accordance with Section 6.02(a). If a Participant requests a later distribution, Annual Allocations shall be
	credited to his Account in accordance with Section 4.02(a) until he begins to receive his distribution, and then interest shall be credited to his Account in accordance with Section 4.02(b) until his Account is fully distributed.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Disability
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant who has suffered a Disability before his eligibility for Normal Retirement shall receive the Retirement Benefit on the first day of the month coincident with or next following
	the date that the Participant attains age sixty-five (65). The Participant may request a later distribution in accordance with Section 6.02(a). If a Participant requests a later distribution, interest shall be credited to his Account in accordance
	with Section 4.02(b) until his Account is fully distributed.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Change in Control.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant whose employment is involuntarily terminated for any reason within two (2)&nbsp;years following a Change in Control shall receive his distribution on the first day of
	the month coincident with or next following the date that is six (6)&nbsp;months after the date of his Separation from Service, provided that if the Participant dies after Separation from Service and before the date that is six (6)&nbsp;months after
	the date of the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service, the Retirement Benefit shall be paid on the first day of the month coincident or next following the date of the Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Death of a Limited Participant.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;The Beneficiaries of a Participant who is actively employed as a Limited Participant on the date of his death shall receive the Limited Participant&#146;s Account
	balance in the form of a lump sum on the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date of the Limited Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 12&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage184"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Death Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Death Benefit payable on behalf of a Participant shall be paid monthly
	beginning on the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date on which the Participant dies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Form of Payment.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Retirement Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Retirement Benefit payable to any Participant shall be paid in a lump
	sum unless the Participant elects to receive his Retirement Benefit in annual installments or in the form of a lump sum on a date later than the date provided under Section 6.01(a)(1) or Section 6.01(a)(2) and such election&#151;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is not effective until at least twelve (12)&nbsp;months after the date on which the election is made,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	defers the first payment with respect to which such election is made for a period of not less than five (5)&nbsp;years from the date such payment would otherwise have been made,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is not made less than twelve (12)&nbsp;months before the date of the first scheduled payment,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	does not result in the Participant&#146;s Retirement Benefit commencing after the later of (A)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service or (B)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s attaining age 70; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	does not result in any part of a Participant&#146;s Retirement Benefit being paid after the earlier of (A)&nbsp;the fifteenth (15th) year after the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service or (B)&nbsp;the
	Participant&#146;s attaining age 85.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If the Participant dies after his retirement under this Plan, the Company shall pay to the
	Participant&#146;s Beneficiaries the remaining unpaid Account balance at the same time and in the same manner as if the Participant had survived.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Death Benefit.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Death Benefit payable on behalf of any Participant shall be paid in equal
	monthly installments that begin as provided in Section 6.01(b) and end in the month in which the Participant would have attained age 80.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.03.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Administrative Acceleration or Delay of Payment.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A payment is treated as being made on the date
	that it is due under the Plan if the payment is made (a)&nbsp;no earlier than thirty (30)&nbsp;days before the due date specified by the Plan or (b)&nbsp;on a date later than the due date specified by the Plan that is either (1)&nbsp;in the same
	Plan Year (for a payment whose specified due date is on or before September 30) or (2)&nbsp;by the fifteenth
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 13&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage185"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(15th) day of the third calendar month following the date specified by the Plan (for a payment whose specified due date is on or after October 1).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.04.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Withholding.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company shall withhold from any payment made pursuant to this Plan any taxes
	the Company reasonably believes are required to be withheld from such payments under local, state, or federal law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.05.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Payment to Guardian.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If a Plan benefit is payable to a minor or a person declared incompetent or
	to a person incapable of handling the disposition of the property, the Committee may direct payment to the guardian, legal representative or person having the care and custody of such minor, incompetent or person. The Committee may require proof of
	incompetency, minority, incapacity or guardianship as it may deem appropriate prior to distribution. Such distribution shall completely discharge the Committee and Company from all liability with respect to such benefit.
<B>
<U>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.06.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Effect of Payment.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The full payment of the applicable benefit under this Article 6 shall
	completely discharge all obligations on the part of the Company to the Participant (and the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary) with respect to the operation of this Plan, and the Participant&#146;s (and Participant&#146;s Beneficiary&#146;s) rights
	under this Plan shall terminate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">

<A NAME="eolPage186"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;BENEFICIARY DESIGNATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.01.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Beneficiary Designation.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each Participant shall have the right, at any time prior to complete
	distribution of the Participant&#146;s vested Account, to designate one (1)&nbsp;or more persons or entity as Beneficiary (both primary as well as secondary) to whom benefits under this Plan shall be paid in the event of the Participant&#146;s
	death. Each Beneficiary designation shall be in a written form prescribed by the Committee and shall be effective only if filed with the Committee during the Participant&#146;s lifetime.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.02.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Changing Beneficiary.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Any Beneficiary designation may be changed without the consent of the
	previously named Beneficiary by the filing of a new Beneficiary designation with the Committee during the Participant&#146;s lifetime.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.03.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	No Beneficiary Designation.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If any Participant fails to designate a Beneficiary in the manner
	provided above, if the designation is void, or if the Beneficiary designated by a deceased Participant dies before the Participant or before complete distribution of the Participant&#146;s benefits, the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary shall be the
	person in the first of the following classes in which there is a survivor:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the Participant&#146;s surviving spouse;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the Participant&#146;s children in equal shares, except that if any of the children predeceases the Participant but leaves surviving issue, then such issue shall take by right of representation the share the
	deceased child would have taken if living; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
	the Participant&#146;s estate.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="73%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;AMETEK, Inc., 2004 Executive Death Benefit Plan (Restated January 1, 2017)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 15&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
