</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(eee)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Roth Contributions
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Roth Contributions&#148; means the portion of a Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions designated irrevocably as Roth
	Contributions pursuant to a Participant election under Section 4.01(a)(3).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(fff)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Roth Contribution Account
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Roth Contribution Account&#148; means the record of assets held by the Trustee for a Participant or Beneficiary under the Plan that is derived from Roth
	Contributions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ggg)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Service
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Service&#148; means, with respect to any Employee, his periods of employment with an Employer or Affiliate that are counted as &#147;Service&#148; in accordance with the
	following rules:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Each Employee will be credited with Service under the Plan for the period or periods during which such Employee maintains an employment relationship with an Employer or Affiliate. An Employee&#146;s employment
	relationship begins on the date the Employee first renders one Hour of Service and ends on his Severance from Service Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in paragraph (1)&nbsp;or subsection (hhh), if an Employee is continuously absent from employment with an Employer or Affiliate for more than one year for a reason described in
	subsection (hhh)(2)(A), the period between the first and second anniversaries of the Employee&#146;s first date of absence will not be treated as Service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Service also will include a Period of Severance between an Employee&#146;s Severance from Service Date and the first anniversary of the date on which the Employee was first absent, if the Employee completes an Hour of
	Service on or before such first anniversary date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Service credit for a period of &#147;qualified military service&#148; will be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;20.03.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(hhh)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Severance from Service Date
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Severance from Service Date&#148; means the earliest of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the date an Employee quits, is discharged, retires, or dies (but not including the date a Participant becomes a Leased Employee); or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the later of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="48%">

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage209"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the second anniversary of the date the Employee is first absent from employment by the Employer or an Affiliate on account of the Employee&#146;s pregnancy, the birth of the Employee&#146;s child, the placement of a
	child with the Employee in connection with the Employee&#146;s adoption of that child, or the Employee&#146;s caring for such child immediately following birth or placement; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the first anniversary of the date the Employee is first absent from employment by the Employer or an Affiliate for any other reason (including a reason other than those set forth in paragraph (1)), such as vacation,
	holiday, sickness, disability, leave of absence (including pursuant to the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 and the regulations thereunder), or layoff.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Spouse
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Spouse&#148; means the individual to whom the Participant is legally married, determined in accordance with IRS Revenue Ruling
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2013-17
</FONT>
	and other relevant guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service and the Department of Labor, as of the earlier of the date on which the first payment of his retirement benefit is to be made or the
	date of his death. For periods before June&nbsp;26, 2013, an individual shall be treated as a Spouse only to the extent provided in the provisions of the Plan then in effect. The term &#147;Spouse&#148; also will include a former Spouse of a
	Participant to the extent required by a Qualified Domestic Relations Order.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(jjj)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Taxable Wage Base
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
	&#147;Taxable Wage Base&#148; for a Plan Year means the contribution and benefit base in effect under section 230 of the Social Security Act on the first day of the
	Plan Year for which allocations of Retirement Contributions are made. The Taxable Wage Base will be deemed to be the full amount of the Taxable Wage Base even if a Participant&#146;s Compensation for a Plan Year is less than the Taxable Wage Base
	for reasons which include becoming a Participant after the first day of the Plan Year or experiencing a Severance From Service Date before the end of the Plan Year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

</FONT>

	Year of Service before the last day of the Plan Year;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

<U>
	Valuation Date
</U>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Valuation Date&#148; means the date as of which the Trustee will determine the value of the assets in the Trust Fund for purposes of enabling the Plan Administrator
	or its delegate to determine the value of the Accounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

</U>

<B>

</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Year of Service&#148; means for any Employee, each consecutive
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period of Service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of the Plan, unless the contrary is clearly indicated by context,
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the use of the masculine gender will also include within its meaning the feminine and vice versa,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the use of the singular will also include within its meaning the plural and vice versa,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the word &#147;include&#148; will mean to include without limitation, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any reference to a statute or section of a statute will further be a reference to any successor or amended statute or section, and any regulations or other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 12&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ELIGIBILITY AND PARTICIPATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Eligibility.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Generally
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in subsection (b), an individual will be eligible to participate in the Plan if the individual is an Eligible Employee and has attained the age of eighteen (18).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Restrictions on Eligibility
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An Employee covered by a currently effective collective bargaining agreement will not be eligible to participate in the Plan unless the Employee is otherwise eligible and the agreement expressly provides for inclusion
	in the Plan of Eligible Employees in his bargaining unit. Expiration of a collective bargaining agreement will not by itself affect an Employee&#146;s status as eligible to participate in the Plan pending execution of a new collective bargaining
	agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	No Employee will be eligible to participate or to continue to participate in the Plan if the applicable laws of any state, country, or other jurisdiction prohibit participation in the Plan or render its provisions
	invalid or inoperative in their application to that Employee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Participation.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Any individual who was a Participant in the Plan immediately preceding the
	Effective Date will be considered a Participant on the Effective Date. Each other Eligible Employee who meets the requirements of Section&nbsp;3.01 will become a Participant on the first day that the Eligible Employee first performs an Hour of
	Service as an Eligible Employee. No Employee will participate before the effective date set forth in Paragraph A of the applicable Adoption Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Cessation of Active Participation.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Once an Eligible Employee has become an active Participant in
	the Plan in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.02, the Eligible Employee will remain a Participant in the Plan until the Participant&#146;s entire Account balance under the Plan has been distributed in accordance with the provisions of the Plan. While a
	Participant is an Eligible Employee, the Participant will be considered an &#147;Active Participant.&#148; During all other periods of participation, a Participant will be considered an &#147;Inactive Participant.&#148; Except as otherwise provided,
	only those Participants who are Active Participants will be entitled to share in Matching, Retirement, or Retirement Incentive Contributions or to elect to make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax,
</FONT>
	Roth,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up,
</FONT>
	or Rollover Contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.04
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Reemployment of Former Employees and Former Participants.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Any person employed by an Employer as
	an Eligible Employee who was previously a Participant or was previously eligible to become a Participant will be immediately eligible to become a Participant in the Plan. Any other person reemployed by an Employer may participate in the Plan on
	meeting the requirements of Section&nbsp;3.02.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 13&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CONTRIBUTIONS BY EMPLOYEES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions and Roth Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Affirmative Election
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Amount of Election
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the limits imposed by Section&nbsp;4.04 and Article 6, a Participant may elect a reduction in Compensation equal to not less than one percent (1%) and not more than fifty
	percent (50%) of his Compensation for each payroll period beginning after the effective date of his election; provided that if the Participant is a Highly Compensated Employee, he may not elect a reduction in Compensation equal to more than ten
	percent (10%) of his Compensation. Pursuant to each such election, the Participant&#146;s Employer Unit will, in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.07, contribute the amount of the reduction in Compensation elected for a payroll period to the Plan on
	the Participant&#146;s behalf as a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution. The Plan Administrator may change the maximum percentages set forth in this subsection at any time with respect to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-discriminatory
</FONT>
	groups of Eligible Employees of an Employer Unit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Election Procedures
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may elect to have Compensation that would otherwise be paid to him by his Employer Unit in cash reduced as provided in subsection (1)&nbsp;by filing an election with
	the Plan Administrator in such form and at such time as the Plan Administrator will require. Such election will be effective on the first day of the first payroll period that follows the date that the election is made, subject to such rules as the
	Plan Administrator may establish for this purpose (including a deadline for making an election effective as of the first day of a particular payroll period). A Participant&#146;s election will evidence the Participant&#146;s agreement, until
	subsequently modified by the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.06, to have contributions made on the Participant&#146;s behalf in accordance with paragraph (1).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Roth Contributions
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may elect to designate all or a portion of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution irrevocably, at the time of the election, as a Roth
	Contribution that is being made in lieu of all or a portion of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution. Roth Contributions shall be includible in the Participant&#146;s income pursuant to section 402A of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Automatic Election of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Amount of Automatic Election
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
	Each Participant will be deemed to have elected to reduce his Compensation by three percent (3%), effective with respect to
	the first administratively feasible payroll period following the thirtieth (30th) day after the Participant receives the notice described in paragraph (2), unless within a reasonable period before such date, as determined by the Plan Administrator,
	the Participant elects in accordance with Section 4.06(a) either to reduce his
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 14&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Compensation by a different percentage or not to make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions. This deemed election will be a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution election for all purposes of the Plan and will remain in effect unless the election is changed by the Participant in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.06(a).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The amount of a deemed
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution election under this Section 4.01(b) will increase by one percent (1%) of Compensation each year until it equals six percent (6%) of
	Compensation as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(I)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the first automatic increase will apply with respect to the first payroll period that begins in January of the year after the year in which the Participant is hired or rehired, as applicable, except that, for
	Participants hired or rehired after October&nbsp;31 of a year, the first automatic increase will not apply until the first payroll period that begins in the second January following their hire or rehire, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(II)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	each subsequent automatic increase will apply with respect to the first payroll period that begins in the January following the first automatic increase or any subsequent automatic increase.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:28%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Any automatic increases in a deemed
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution election will remain in place until the
	Participant&#146;s deemed election equals six percent (6%) of Compensation unless the Participant revokes or changes his election pursuant to Section 4.06(a) before that time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Notice Regarding Automatic Election
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Timing of Notice
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;At least thirty (30)&nbsp;days, but not more than ninety (90)&nbsp;days, before each Plan Year, the Plan Administrator will provide each Participant a comprehensive notice described
	in paragraph (B), below, written in a manner calculated to be understood by the average Participant. If a Participant is hired (or rehired following a Severance from Service Date) or becomes eligible to participate in the Plan after the ninetieth
	(90th) day before the beginning of the Plan Year and does not receive the notice for that reason, the notice will be provided no earlier than ninety (90)&nbsp;days before the date that the Participant becomes eligible to participate in the Plan but
	not later than the first administratively feasible date after the Participant becomes eligible to participate in the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Content of Notice
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The notice will describe:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(I)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the amount of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions that will be made on the Participant&#146;s behalf pursuant to an automatic election;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 15&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage214"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(II)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant&#146;s right to elect not to have any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions made on his or her behalf or to elect to reduce his Compensation by a different percentage or not to
	make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(III)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	how
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions made pursuant to an automatic election will be invested in the absence of the Participant&#146;s investment instructions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Amount of Election
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the limits imposed by Section&nbsp;4.04 and Article 6, a Participant may elect to make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions to the Plan equal
	to not less than one percent (1%) and not more than fifty percent (50%) of his Compensation for each payroll period beginning after the effective date of his election; provided that if the Participant is a Highly Compensated Employee, he may not
	elect a reduction in Compensation equal to more than (eight percent (8%) of his Compensation. Pursuant to each such election, the Participant&#146;s Employer Unit will, in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.07, contribute the amount of the reduction in
	Compensation elected for a payroll period to the Plan on the Participant&#146;s behalf as an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution. The Plan Administrator may change the maximum percentages set forth in this subsection at
	any time with respect to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-discriminatory
</FONT>
	groups of Eligible Employees of an Employer Unit. Any portion of an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution made by a Participant for any Plan
	Year that exceeds the maximum amount permitted by the Plan shall be returned to him, together with the allocable gain or loss, as soon as practicable and shall not be considered an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution for
	any purpose of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Election Procedures
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may elect to have Compensation that would otherwise be paid to him by his Employer Unit in cash reduced as provided in subsection (a)&nbsp;by filing an election with
	the Plan Administrator in such form and at such time as the Plan Administrator will require. Such election will be effective on the first day of the first payroll period that follows the date that the election is made, subject to such rules as the
	Plan Administrator may establish for this purpose (including a deadline for making an election effective as of the first day of a particular payroll period). A Participant&#146;s election will evidence the Participant&#146;s agreement, until
	subsequently modified by the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.06, to have contributions made on the Participant&#146;s behalf in accordance with subsection (a).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each Participant who has
	attained (or will attain) age 50 before the close of a Plan Year and on whose behalf his Employer Unit is contributing the maximum combined
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	and Roth Contributions permitted under the Plan (by reason of
	either Section&nbsp;4.01, Section&nbsp;4.04, or Article 6) may elect, in accordance with the procedures described in Section 4.01(a)(2), an additional reduction in Compensation of no more than the least of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Fifty percent (50%) of the Participant&#146;s Compensation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	(b)
</TD>

	$5,000, as adjusted by the Internal Revenue Service in accordance with section 414(v)(2)(C) of the Code; or

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The excess, if any, of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant&#146;s Compensation (as defined in Section 6.02(c)(2)) for the Plan Year, over
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	and Roth Contributions for the Plan Year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Pursuant to each such election by a Participant, the Participant&#146;s Employer Unit will, in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.07, contribute the amount
	of the reduction in Compensation to the Plan on the Participant&#146;s behalf as a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contribution.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions are not subject to the limits of
	Section&nbsp;4.04 or Article 6.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.04
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Limitation on Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Except as provided in Section&nbsp;4.03 (with respect to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions), the sum of a Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax,
</FONT>
	Roth, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions for any payroll period shall not
	exceed fifty percent (50%) of his Compensation for that payroll period; provided that if the Participant is a Highly Compensated Employee: (a)&nbsp;the sum of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	and Roth Contributions shall not
	exceed ten percent (10%) of his Compensation for that payroll period, and (b)&nbsp;his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions shall not exceed eight percent (8%) of his Compensation for that payroll period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.05
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Rollover Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Subject to Plan Administrator procedures and without regard to any limitations on contributions set forth in Section 4.01(a), 4.02, 4.03, 4.04, or Article 6, the Plan may receive from an Eligible Employee, regardless of
	whether he has completed the age requirements of Section&nbsp;3.01, in cash, any portion of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an eligible rollover distribution (as defined in subsection (f)) paid to an Eligible Employee from an eligible retirement plan (as defined in subsection (f)), provided that the rollover satisfies the requirements of
	section 402(c) or 408(d)(3)(A) of the Code and the Eligible Employee pays such amount to the Trustee on or before the 60th day after the day it was received by the Eligible Employee; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an eligible rollover distribution (as defined in subsection (f)) paid as a direct rollover that satisfies section 401(a)(31) of the Code to the Trustee on behalf of the Eligible Employee by an eligible retirement plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Plan will accept amounts attributable to a designated Roth account or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	amounts; provided that such rollover is in the form of a direct rollover described in
	subsection (a)(2).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
	Upon approval by the Plan Administrator, the amount transferred to the Plan by an Eligible Employee pursuant to this
	Section&nbsp;4.05 will be credited to the Eligible Employee&#146;s Rollover Contribution Account, and, in accordance with Article 7, shall be allocated within such Rollover Contribution Account to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Rollover,
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage216"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Roth Rollover, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Rollover Subaccounts, as applicable. The Eligible Employee will be fully vested in his Rollover Contribution Account and will
	share in allocations of income, gains and losses from investment options.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Upon a transfer described in this Section&nbsp;4.05 by an Eligible Employee who is not a Participant, the Eligible Employee&#146;s Rollover Contribution Account will represent his sole interest in the Plan until he
	becomes a Participant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Plan Administrator will develop such other procedures and may require such information from an Eligible Employee as it deems necessary or desirable to determine that a proposed rollover will meet the requirements of
	this Section&nbsp;4.05 and that the amount rolled over qualifies for rollover treatment pursuant to applicable provisions of the Code. If the Plan Administrator determines that any Rollover Contribution previously made to the Plan by a Participant
	is not a valid Rollover Contribution, the Plan Administrator will return to the Participant, as soon as administratively possible, the amount of the invalid Rollover Contribution, together with earnings attributable to the Rollover Contribution.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For purposes of this Section&nbsp;4.05, the following terms are defined as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Eligible Rollover Distribution
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;An &#147;Eligible Rollover Distribution&#148; is all or any portion of the distribution from an eligible retirement plan, excluding (A)&nbsp;any distribution that is one
	of a series of substantially equal periodic payments (not less frequently than annually) made for the life (or life expectancy) of the Eligible Employee and his designated beneficiary, or for a specified period of ten years or more; (B)&nbsp;any
	distribution to the extent such distribution is required under section 401(a)(9) of the Code; or (C)&nbsp;any amount that is distributed on account of hardship.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Eligible Retirement Plan
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;An &#147;Eligible Retirement Plan&#148; means (A)&nbsp;a qualified plan described in section 401(a) or 403(a) of the Code; (B)&nbsp;an annuity contract described in section
	403(b) of the Code; (C)&nbsp;an eligible plan under section 457(b) of the Code which is maintained by a state, political subdivision of a state, or any agency or instrumentality of a state or political subdivision of a state; (D)&nbsp;an individual
	retirement account or annuity described in section 408(a) or 408(b) of the Code; or (E)&nbsp;a Roth individual retirement account described in section 408A(b) of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.06
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Changes and Suspensions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant may elect to:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	discontinue
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions and receive cash,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	resume
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	change the rate of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax,
</FONT>
	Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 18&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	by filing an election with the Plan Administrator in such form as the Plan Administrator may require. Such
	election will be effective on the first day of the first payroll period that follows the date that the election is made, discontinued, or changed, subject to such rules as the Plan Administrator may establish for this purpose (including a deadline
	for making, discontinuing, or changing an election effective as of the first day of a particular payroll period). The Plan Administrator, in its sole discretion, may permit such election to be transmitted electronically or telephonically, to the
	extent permitted by, and in accordance with any procedures set forth in, applicable law and regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant may elect for his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions to automatically increase each Plan Year by either one percent (1%), two percent (2%) or three percent (3%) of Compensation
	to the extent that the increases do not cause the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions to exceed the applicable limits
	described in Section&nbsp;4.01(a), 4.03, 4.04, and Article 6. The Participant may elect the month that the increase will become effective during a Plan Year, and any increase will be applied beginning with Compensation earned during the first
	payroll period of that month. If the Participant does not elect a month for the automatic increase to apply, the increase will be applied effective beginning with Compensation earned during the first payroll period that begins in each Plan Year. A
	Participant may prospectively elect, at any time, to apply, discontinue or to change the time and amount of an automatic increase to the amount of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a Participant ceases to receive Compensation due to a change of status of employment, the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions will be automatically suspended as of the date of the change of status and discontinued as of the later of two and one half
	months after the change of status or the end of the Plan Year in which the change of status occurs. If a Participant&#146;s contributions are discontinued due to a change of status of employment, his participation in the Plan upon his reemployment
	will be subject to Section&nbsp;3.04. If a Participant ceases to receive Compensation by reason of a layoff, an authorized leave of absence, or a change of status of employment that does not result in discontinuance of the Participant&#146;s
	contributions, the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions will be automatically suspended at the beginning of the leave period or as of the date of the change of status of employment and will be automatically reinstated upon his return.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An Employer Unit may suspend a Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions
<B>
</B>
	at any time
	if, based on the Employer Unit&#146;s estimates, suspension appears to be necessary to avoid or reduce any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	adjustment that it otherwise may expect to make under Section&nbsp;6.02.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	No Employee will make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions for any payroll period beginning after the effective date as set forth in Paragraph A of an applicable Exit Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.07
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Credit to Accounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Employer Units will make payment in cash of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, Roth Contributions,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions to the Trustee. The Trustee will credit the amounts so received to the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution, Roth Contribution,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contribution Accounts, respectively, of the appropriate Participants as soon as administratively feasible after receipt of the
	amounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Each contribution made by the Employer Units pursuant to the provisions of this Article 4 is made expressly contingent on its deductibility for federal income tax purposes for the fiscal year with respect to which such
	contribution is made, and no such contribution will be made for any year to the extent it would exceed the deductible limit for such year as set forth in section&nbsp;404 of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Page 20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage219"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Matching Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Subject to the limitations imposed by Article 6, the appropriate Employer Unit will contribute for each Participant the lesser of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the percentage specified in Paragraph E of the applicable Adoption Agreement multiplied by the sum of any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions and Roth Contributions (not including
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-up
</FONT>
	Contributions or amounts initially intended to be
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-up
</FONT>
	Contributions but reclassified as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions or Roth
	Contributions pursuant to Section 6.01(b)) made on behalf of that Participant for that payroll period, or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the maximum Matching Contribution specified in Paragraph E of the applicable Adoption Agreement;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	provided, however, that if the Participant is an active participant in a defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Company or an Affiliate, and
	paragraph E of the applicable Adoption Agreement does not provide for Retirement Contributions and/or Retirement Incentive Contributions on behalf of any Eligible Employee, the Employer Unit will contribute for the Participant 33 1/3% of the
	Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions (but not
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions), on the first 6% of such Eligible Employee&#146;s Eligible Compensation for the applicable
	payroll period, up to a maximum Matching Contribution of 2% of the Participant&#146;s Compensation for the applicable payroll period; provided that the Matching Contribution made on behalf of any such Participant will not exceed $1,200 in any Plan
	Year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Employer Units will make payment in cash of Matching Contributions to the Trustee as soon as practicable after the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions and Roth Contributions
<B>
</B>
	on which
	such Matching Contributions are based are contributed to the Plan. Matching Contributions will be allocated to Participants&#146; Matching Contribution Accounts in accordance with Section&nbsp;7.02(g).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Retirement Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subject to the limitations imposed by Article 6, if a Participant is
	eligible for a Retirement Contribution, as provided in Paragraph E of the applicable Adoption Agreement, the appropriate Employer Unit will contribute to the Plan a percentage (based upon the table set forth below) of the Compensation earned for
	each payroll period during the Plan Year that the Participant is eligible for a Retirement Contribution.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="13">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	65 or more, but less than 75
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5%
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="13">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="13" COLSPAN="2">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	75 or more
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6%
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8%
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.02, a Participant&#146;s age and full Years of Service means the
	Participant&#146;s age and full Years of Service, not rounded, on the first day of the Plan Year. A Participant who is reemployed after having a Period of Severance of at least one year will not receive credit for Years of Service preceding the
	Period of Severance for purposes of calculating a Retirement Contribution under this Section&nbsp;5.02.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Retirement Contributions will be allocated
	to eligible Participants&#146; Retirement Contribution Accounts in accordance with Section 7.02(h).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Retirement Incentive Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subject to the limitations imposed by Article 6, if a
	Participant who is eligible for a Retirement Contribution under Section&nbsp;5.02 elects to make
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions and/or Roth Contributions to the Plan in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.01 (not including
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions or amounts initially intended to be
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions but reclassified as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions or Roth
	Contributions pursuant to Section 6.01(b)) in an amount equal to not less than six percent (6%) of his Compensation for any payroll period, his Employer Unit will contribute to the Plan for such payroll period an amount equal to one percent (1%) of
	the Participant&#146;s Compensation for that payroll period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Employer Units will make payment in cash of Retirement Incentive Contributions to the
	Trustee as soon as practicable after the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contributions
<B>
</B>
	and/or Roth Contributions on which such Retirement Incentive Contributions are based are contributed to the Plan. Retirement Incentive
	Contributions will be allocated to Participants&#146; Retirement Incentive Contribution Accounts in accordance with Section 7.02(i).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.04
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Discretionary Contributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Subject to the limitations imposed by Article 6, an Employer Unit
	may make a contribution to the Plan in such amount as the Employer Unit may, in its sole discretion, deem appropriate, and such amount may be zero. Any Discretionary Contribution will be allocated to the Discretionary Contribution Account of each
	Participant who (a) is a member of a group that has been designated as included in the definition of &#147;Eligible Employee&#148; in Paragraph D of the appropriate Adoption Agreement, and (b) completes at least one (1) Hour of Service with the
	Employer Unit during the Plan Year in the same ratio that each such Participant&#146;s Compensation for such Plan Year bears to the total Compensation of all such eligible Participants for the Plan Year. Notwithstanding the foregoing, an Employer
	Unit may provide in the written instrument providing for the Discretionary Contribution a different group of Participants or basis for allocating the Discretionary Contribution that satisfies the nondiscrimination requirements of
	section&nbsp;401(a)(4) of the Code and otherwise complies with the requirements of the Code and ERISA.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>

</TD>

	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Page 22&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage221"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.05
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Credit to Accounts.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Employer Contributions made pursuant to this Article 5 for any Plan Year
	will be made no later than the last day on which amounts may be deducted for federal income tax purposes for the taxable year of the Employer Unit in which the Plan Year ends. Each contribution made by Employer Units pursuant to the provisions of
	this Article 5 is made expressly contingent on its deductibility for federal income tax purposes for the fiscal year with respect to which such contribution is made, and no such contribution will be made for any year to the extent it would exceed
	the deductible limit for such year as set forth in section 404 of the Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

</TD>

	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Page 23&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
