<A NAME="eolPage236"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;VESTING
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Immediate Vesting.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant will at all times be 100% vested in and have a nonforfeitable
	right to the value of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, his Roth Contribution Account, his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, his Matching Contribution Account, and his Rollover Contribution Account. A Participant will be 100% vested in and have a nonforfeitable right to the value of his Discretionary
	Contribution Account unless otherwise provided in the written instrument providing for the Discretionary Contribution.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Delayed Vesting.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Unless an event described in Section&nbsp;9.03 occurs earlier, a Participant
	will be 100% vested in and have a nonforfeitable right to the value of his Retirement Contribution Account and his Retirement Incentive Contribution Account after completing three (3)&nbsp;Years of Service.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Vesting Upon Certain Events.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Each Participant will become fully vested in his Retirement
	Contribution Account and his Retirement Incentive Contribution Account upon the first to occur of the following events:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	death while employed by the Employer and or an Affiliate;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	employment with the Employer and its Affiliates that terminates at or after the later of (1)&nbsp;a Participant&#146;s 65
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	birthday or (2)&nbsp;the fifth (5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	) anniversary of the Participant&#146;s commencement of participation in the Plan;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	becoming Disabled while employed by the Employer or an Affiliate;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	termination of the Plan;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	a partial termination of the Plan applicable to the Participant as provided in Section&nbsp;18.02; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	upon a sale or closing of a covered location, to the extent set forth in an applicable Exit Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.04
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Forfeitures.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Upon termination of employment, a Participant who is not fully vested in his Retirement Contribution Account or Retirement Incentive Contribution Account will forfeit the entire unvested amounts in these Accounts as of
	the earlier of (1)&nbsp;the date on which he receives a distribution of his Retirement Contribution Account or Retirement Incentive Account, as applicable, or (2)&nbsp;the date on which he incurs a Period of Severance of at least five
	(5)&nbsp;years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
	Any amounts forfeited under subsection (a)&nbsp;will be restored if the Participant is reemployed with the Employer or an
	Affiliate before incurring a Period of
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 38&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage237"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Severance of at least five (5)&nbsp;years. Such restored amounts will be allocated to the Participant&#146;s Retirement Contribution Account and his Retirement Incentive Account. In addition, for
	purposes of Section&nbsp;9.02, the Participant&#146;s vested right to the amount so contributed will be determined based upon his Years of Service completed both before and after his Period of Severance.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a Participant who was eligible to receive Retirement Contributions or Retirement Incentive Contributions incurs a Period of Severance of less than five (5)&nbsp;consecutive years, such Employee&#146;s Years of
	Service completed before the Period of Severance will be taken into account to determine the vested percentage of his Retirement Contribution Account or Retirement Incentive Contribution Account upon his reemployment by an Employer or an Affiliate,
	whether or not the Participant is again eligible to receive Retirement Contributions or Retirement Incentive Contributions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Retirement Contributions or Retirement Incentive Contributions forfeited in any Plan Year pursuant to this Section&nbsp;9.04 will be applied (1)&nbsp;to reduce any future Employer Contributions, or (2)&nbsp;to pay
	reasonable expenses of administering the Plan. Any forfeitures used to reduce future Employer Contributions may be allocated among the types of Employer Contributions in any manner that the Plan Administrator or their designee deems to be
	appropriate.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A NAME="eolPage238"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WITHDRAWALS DURING EMPLOYMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Limited
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	In-Service
</FONT>
	Withdrawals.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant who has
	not terminated employment may request a distribution of all or part of his Account only as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Age 59
</U>
<U>
	&#189;
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant who has attained age 59
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
	&#8260;
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM">
	2
</SUB>
	may request a distribution of the sum of the
	outstanding balances in his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, Roth Contribution Account,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, vested Matching Contribution Account, and Rollover Contribution Account at any time less any outstanding loan the Participant may have. Such distribution will be made as soon as practicable following the Plan
	Administrator&#146;s receipt of the Participant&#146;s request for withdrawal in the form and manner required by the Plan Administrator and will be made in the form of a single lump sum payment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may withdraw all or part of his
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account, including
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	contributions that have been transferred to the Plan from a plan that is merged into the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;18.04; provided, however, that (i)&nbsp;the minimum withdrawal shall be $1,000 (or, if
	less, the balance of the Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account), and (ii)&nbsp;a Participant may request only one such withdrawal in any Plan Year. The limits on the amount and frequency of
	withdrawals shall not apply to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	contributions that have been transferred to the Plan from a plan that is merged into the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;18.04. If a Participant&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account includes amounts attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	contributions made before January&nbsp;1, 1987, such contributions shall be withdrawn before amounts
	attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	contributions made after December&nbsp;31, 1986, or earnings on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-1987
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	contributions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Hardship Withdrawal
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may request a hardship withdrawal to the extent permitted by Section&nbsp;10.02.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Hardship Withdrawals.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant who has not terminated employment may request, in the manner prescribed by the Plan Administrator, a distribution in the event the Participant has a hardship as defined in subsections (b)&nbsp;and (c).
	Hardship withdrawals are limited to the excess of (1)&nbsp;the sum of the Participant&#146;s Rollover Contribution Account,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account (excluding earnings), Roth Contribution Account
	(excluding earnings),
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contribution Account (excluding earnings), and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax
</FONT>
	Contribution Account (excluding earnings) over (2)&nbsp;the sum of (i)&nbsp;any
	outstanding loan the Participant may have and (ii)&nbsp;the sum of all prior distributions from such Accounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A distribution will be made on account of hardship only if the distribution is necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need of the Participant. For purposes of this Plan, a distribution is made on account
	of an immediate and heavy financial need of the Participant only if the distribution is for:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 40&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage239"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	expenses for (or necessary to obtain) medical care that would be deductible under section 213(d) of the Code (determined without regard to whether the expenses exceed the adjusted gross income threshold specified in
	section 213(a) of the Code);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	costs directly related to the purchase of a principal residence for the Participant (excluding mortgage payments);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the payment of tuition, related educational fees, room and board for up to the next twelve (12)&nbsp;months of post-secondary education for the Participant, his or her Spouse, children, or dependents (as defined in Code
	section 152, but without regard to sections 152(b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B));
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	payments necessary to prevent eviction of the Participant from his principal residence or foreclosure on the mortgage of the Participant&#146;s principal residence;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the payment of burial or funeral expenses for the Participant&#146;s deceased Spouse, child, parent other dependents (as defined in Code section 152, but without regard to section 152(d)(1)(B)); or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(6)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	expenses for the repair of damage to the Participant&#146;s principal residence that would qualify for the casualty deduction under section 165 of the Code (determined without regard to whether the loss exceeds 10% of
	adjusted gross income).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A distribution will be considered necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need of the Participant only if all three (3)&nbsp;of the following requirements are satisfied:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the distribution is not in excess of the amount required to relieve the immediate and heavy financial need of the Participant (taking into account the taxable nature of the distribution);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant has obtained (or is currently obtaining) all distributions, withdrawals, and loans available under the Plan and all other plans maintained by any Employer or any Affiliate other than hardship
	distributions and the Participant represents in writing, on forms provided by the Plan Administrator and by providing any documentation required by the Plan Administrator, that the need cannot be relieved through reimbursement or compensation by
	insurance or otherwise, by reasonable liquidation of the Participant&#146;s assets, to the extent such liquidation would not itself cause an immediate and heavy financial need, by cessation of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax,
</FONT>
	Roth,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax,
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions under the Plan, by withdrawals, distributions (other than hardship distributions) or nontaxable loans (at the time of the loan) from any
	plan maintained by any other entity by which the Participant is employed, or by borrowing from commercial sources on reasonable commercial terms; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 41&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="eolPage240"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Plan Administrator determines that it can reasonably rely on the Participant&#146;s written representation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Distributions pursuant to this Section will be made as soon as practicable following the Plan Administrator&#146;s approval of the Participant&#146;s written request for withdrawal and will be made in the form of a
	single lump sum payment. The Plan Administrator may request any documentation it may require from a Participant to make a determination that the Participant is eligible for a hardship withdrawal.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant who receives a hardship withdrawal under this Section&nbsp;10.02 will be prohibited from making
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pre-Tax,
</FONT>
	Roth,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	After-Tax,
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Catch-Up
</FONT>
	Contributions under this Plan and elective deferrals and employee contributions under all other plans of the Employer or an Affiliate for six months after receipt of the distribution.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A hardship withdrawal fee, in an amount to be determined by the Plan Administrator annually, may be charged to each Participant receiving an approved hardship withdrawal and will be deducted from the Participant&#146;s
	Account.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 42&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage241"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LOANS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	In General.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Plan Administrator is authorized to administer a loan program under the Plan,
	pursuant to this Article 11. The loan program and this Article 11 are intended to comply with the requirements of section 4975(d)(1) of the Code and section 408(b)(1) of ERISA, and the regulations thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Eligibility for Loans.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Loans will be made available to Participants. Beneficiaries and Alternate
	Payees are not eligible to receive loans under the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Application for Loans.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	A Participant may borrow from the Plan a portion of the balance of his
	Accounts, excluding his Retirement Contribution Account or Retirement Incentive Contribution Account, by making application to the Plan Administrator in writing on a form designated by the Plan Administrator.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.04
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Treatment of Loans and Loan Repayments.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The value of the Participant&#146;s affected Accounts then invested in Investment Funds will be liquidated on a pro rata basis to the extent required to provide sufficient cash to make the loan, provided that no portion
	of a borrowed amount will be charged against Insurance Contracts unless value of amounts held in other Investment Funds is less than the borrowed amount and then only to the extent permitted under the Insurance Contract. The cash will be transferred
	to the Loan Fund from which all loans will be made.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The investment earnings of the Loan Fund that are attributable to any loan made or renegotiated pursuant to the promissory note (including the interest on any such loan) will be allocated to a separate loan account
	established on behalf of the Participant who made or renegotiated the loan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	As of each Valuation Date, the interest allocated pursuant to subsection (b), above, will be reallocated among and invested in the then available Investment Funds in the same proportions as the current Employee and
	Employer Contributions on behalf of the Participant are invested; provided that if no such contributions are being made on behalf of the Participant as of such Valuation Date, such interest will be invested in accordance with the Participant&#146;s
	most recent allocation election pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.02 or 8.03 or, if the Participant fails to make an allocation election, in accordance with the default allocation provided under Section&nbsp;8.02.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
	A Participant&#146;s repayment of the principal of a loan will reduce the Participant&#146;s interest in the Loan Fund and
	will be invested as soon as practicable in the then available Investment Funds first, to repay any amount that may have been borrowed under the terms of any Insurance Contracts allocated to the Participant&#146;s Accounts if such loan was originally
	charged against such Insurance
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 43&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage242"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Contracts and second, in the same proportions as the current Employee and Employer Contributions on behalf of each such Participant are invested; provided that if no such contributions are then
	being made on behalf of the Participant, such repayments will be invested in accordance with the Participant&#146;s most recent allocation election pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.02 or 8.03 or, if the Participant fails to make an allocation election, in
	accordance with the default allocation provided under Section&nbsp;8.02 of the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.05
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Terms and Conditions of Loans.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All loans pursuant to the loan program will be made to
	Participants on the following terms and conditions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Amount
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A loan will not be made to a Participant pursuant to the loan program unless, immediately after the loan is approved, the total outstanding balance of all loans made to the Participant pursuant
	to the loan program (including the loan that is then being approved) does not exceed 50% of the vested balance of the Participant&#146;s Account less the value of the sum of any Retirement Contribution Account and Retirement Incentive Contribution
	Account; nor may any single loan pursuant to the loan program be for an amount that is:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	more than $50,000 (reduced by the excess (if any) of the highest outstanding balance of the loans made to the Participant pursuant to the loan program during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	period
	ending on the day before the date on which the loan is made over the outstanding balance of the loans made to the Participant pursuant to the loan program on the date on which the loan is made), or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	less than $1,000.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Number of Outstanding Loans
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may have no more than two (2)&nbsp;outstanding loans at any time. If a Participant already has an outstanding loan from his Accounts, he may apply for a
	second loan, provided that (1)&nbsp;the application is made no sooner than six (6)&nbsp;months after the last loan application, (2)&nbsp;the limits described in subsection (a)&nbsp;are not exceeded by the total outstanding balance of the two loans,
	and (3)&nbsp;if the proceeds of the first loan were intended to be used by the Participant to acquire the principal residence of the Participant, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in subsection (a), the proceeds of the second loan may not be
	used to acquire a principal residence and the Participant will be required to repay the amount of the second loan within five (5)&nbsp;years of the date of the loan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Loan Terms Must Be In Writing
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The loan will be evidenced in a written instrument for the amount of the loan plus interest, executed by the Participant, on which the Participant will be personally
	liable and which will be payable to the Trustee. The written instrument will state the terms of the loan. The written instrument for the loan and the instrument granting the Plan a security interest in the Participant&#146;s Account will be executed
	by the Participant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<U>
	Security
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The loan will be secured by the Participant&#146;s entire right, title, and interest in and to
	the portion of the balance of the Participant&#146;s Account equal to
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 44&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage243"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the amount of the loan (up to 50% of the vested balance, excluding the balance in any Retirement Contribution Account or Retirement Incentive Contribution Account, as of the time the loan is
	made). The Plan Administrator may request such other or further security as it deems necessary and prudent from time to time, in order to protect the Plan from risk of loss of principal or income if a default were to occur.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Term of Loan
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The term of the loan will be for at least 1 and not more than 5 years from the disbursement of the loan, except that the term of a loan to purchase principal residence for the Participant
	may be for not more than 10 years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Interest
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The unpaid balance of any loan will bear interest at a reasonable fixed rate as determined by the Plan Administrator based on interest rates charged by commercial lending institutions for
	loans that would be made under similar circumstances.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(g)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Repayment of Loan
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	The repayment of the loan will be made by payroll deduction, authorized by the Participant at the time of applying for the loan, in a level amount sufficient to amortize the balance of the
	loan, together with interest, over the term of the loan; provided that the Participant may prepay the loan in full, without penalty, at any time by payment in cash; and further provided that, if the Participant&#146;s Compensation is insufficient to
	permit the repayment of the loan, together with interest, by payroll deduction, the Participant will make payments in cash of amounts sufficient to amortize the balance of the loan, together with interest, over the term of the loan. Payroll
	deductions will commence as of the payday for the first payroll period beginning on or after the date as of which the loan is made, or as soon thereafter as practicable, and will be made with the same frequency as the Participant is paid but not
	less frequently than quarterly.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Leaves of Absence.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant becomes Disabled or is on an approved unpaid leave of absence, the Plan Administrator may, in its sole discretion, waive payments for up to one (1)&nbsp;year and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-amortize
</FONT>
	the loan and establish a new loan payment schedule pursuant to which the loan will be repaid in full by the original maturity date of the Participant&#146;s note and the number of installments due after
	the leave ends is not less than the number required under the terms of the original loan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Military Service.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant is absent during a period of qualified military service (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;20.01, repayment will be waived during such period and, upon the
	Participant&#146;s reemployment by an Employer within the time during which the Participant&#146;s right to reemployment is protected by applicable law, the loan payment schedule will resume with the original maturity date of the promissory note
	adjusted to reflect the period of qualified military service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 45&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage244"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(h)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Default
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A failure to make a scheduled payment, or the filing of an application for a benefit distribution (other than a hardship withdrawal pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.02 or a distribution on or after
	a Participant reaches age 59 1/2 pursuant to Section 10.01(a)) under this Plan, or any other default event set forth by the Plan Administrator in the promissory notice for a Participant&#146;s loan will constitute events of default. If a Participant
	defaults on a loan and such failure is not cured on or before the last day of the quarter next following the quarter in which the event of default occurs, the unpaid principal and accrued interest due under the loan will be declared immediately
	payable in full and may be charged back against the Participant&#146;s Accounts as a distribution at the earliest time that the Participant is entitled to receive a distribution under this Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Loan Fees
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;A loan origination fee, in an amount determined by the Plan Administrator annually, may be charged to each Participant obtaining a loan and will be deducted from the loan proceeds. In
	addition, a loan maintenance fee, in an amount determined by the Plan Administrator, may be charged to each Participant and will be deducted from such Participant&#146;s Accounts for each Plan Year during which such loan is outstanding.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.06
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Rollover Loans.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Plan Administrator may, in its sole discretion, accept a rollover loan if
	permitted under Paragraph F of the applicable Adoption Agreement. Such loans will be subject to such rules and regulations as the Plan Administrator in its discretion may establish; provided, that unless expressly provided otherwise in an applicable
	Adoption Agreement, (a)&nbsp;a rolled over loan will not be accepted unless the entire account from which the loan was taken is transferred to the Plan, (b)&nbsp;any rolled over loan will remain subject to the terms of the promissory note in effect
	at the time of the rollover, and (c)&nbsp;a rolled over loan will count toward the limits set forth in Section&nbsp;11.05 on the number of loans that may be outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 46&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage245"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLE 12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DISTRIBUTION OF ACCOUNTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.01
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Distribution Events.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If a Participant ceases to be an Employee or becomes Disabled while
	employed, all of his Accounts to the extent then vested under Article 9 will become distributable unless the Plan Administrator determines in good faith that under applicable law distribution cannot be made without risking the continuing qualified
	status of the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.02
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Forms of Distribution.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	When an Account becomes distributable to a Participant or Beneficiary, the Plan Administrator will direct the Trustee to distribute the Account in accordance with clause (1), (2) or (3)&nbsp;below:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a Participant ceases to be an Employee on account of death, the vested portion of his Account will be distributed to his Beneficiary in the form of a lump sum.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a Participant ceases to be an Employee before reaching Normal Retirement Age, the vested portion if his Account will be distributed to him in the form of a lump sum.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a Participant ceases to be an Employee after reaching Normal Retirement Age or becomes Disabled, the Participant may elect, in accordance with procedures established by the Plan Administrator regarding the election
	of distributions to receive the vested portion of his Account in one of the following forms:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	one lump sum payment;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	payments made over a certain period specified by the Participant in monthly, quarterly, or semi-annual installments provided, however, that the period over which such payments are to be made may not exceed 15 years or,
	if shorter, the life expectancy of the Participant. In order to provide installment payments, the Plan Administrator will invest the remaining balance held in the Participant&#146;s Account in accordance with Sections 8.02 or 8.03 pursuant to the
	instructions of the Participant. An annual administrative fee will be deducted from the Participant&#146;s Account for installment payments in an amount determined by the Trustee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Distributions will be in the form of cash, except that a Participant or Beneficiary whose benefit will be paid in the form of a lump sum, may request that any portion of the Participant&#146;s Account that is invested
	in the Company Stock Fund or in shares of any other Investment Fund be distributed in shares of Company Stock or shares held in any other Investment Fund, plus cash for any fractional shares.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 47&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage246"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.03
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Timing of Distributions.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any distribution will be made as soon as administratively practicable after the Participant or Beneficiary, as the case may be, returns a completed benefit distribution form to the Plan Administrator. Subject to
	subsections (c)&nbsp;or (d), a Participant&#146;s Account must be distributed no later than the 60th day after the close of the Plan Year in which the latest of the following events occurs:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Participant attains age sixty-five (65);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the tenth anniversary of the year in which the Participant began to participate in the Plan; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the termination of the Participant&#146;s employment with the Employer or an Affiliate;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	provided,
	however, that the Participant may elect to defer distribution of benefits under the Plan until any time before his Required Beginning Date as defined in subsection (d)(2)(A).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Until benefits are distributed, a Participant&#146;s Account will be held and invested in accordance with Sections 8.02 or 8.03 pursuant to the
	instructions of the Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the Participant dies after distributions have commenced under Section 12.02(a)(3)(B), but before the total of a Participant&#146;s Account has been distributed, the remainder of the Participant&#146;s Account will be
	distributed at least as rapidly as the method of distribution in effect on the date of the Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in subsection (a), if the value of a Participant&#146;s Account (calculated by excluding the portion of the Participant&#146;s Account attributable to his Rollover Contribution
	Account, and rollover contributions made to a plan that was merged with and into the Plan) is $5,000 or less, the Plan Administrator will pay such benefit in a single lump sum as soon as practicable after the retirement, termination, Disability or
	death of the Participant, and any such distribution to the Participant or his Beneficiary, as the case may be, will be in complete discharge of the Plan&#146;s obligation with respect to such benefit. In the event of a mandatory distribution greater
	than $1,000 in accordance with this subsection (c), if the Participant does not elect to have such distribution paid directly to an Eligible Retirement Plan in a direct rollover or to receive the distribution directly in accordance with
	Section&nbsp;13.01, then the Plan Administrator will pay the distribution in a direct rollover to an individual retirement plan designated by the Plan Administrator.
<B>
</B>
	For purposes of determining whether a mandatory distribution exceeds $1,000,
	a Participant&#146;s Roth Contribution Account will be considered separately from the remainder of the Participant&#146;s Account.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;The AMETEK Retirement and Savings Plan
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Page 48&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage247"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Delay of Distributions
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following provisions will apply to limit a Participant&#146;s
	ability to delay the distribution of benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	General Rules.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The form and timing of all distributions under this subsection (d)&nbsp;will be in accordance with section 401(a)(9) of the Code, including the incidental death benefit requirements of section 401(a)(9)(G) of the Code,
	and Treasury Regulations under section 401(a)(9) that were published on April&nbsp;17, 2002 or any subsequent guidance interpreting section 401(a)(9) or any amendments thereto.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this subsection (d), a Participant or Beneficiary who would have been required to receive a distribution for 2009 pursuant to this subsection (d)&nbsp;but for the
	enactment of section 401(a)(9)(H) of the Code (or for any subsequent year to which section 401(a)(9)(H) of the Code applies), and who would have satisfied the requirements of this subsection (d)&nbsp;by receiving a distribution that is
	(I)&nbsp;equal to the required minimum distribution under subsection (3)&nbsp;or (4) or (II)&nbsp;part of a series of substantially equal distributions that include such required minimum distribution, will not receive such distribution unless the
	Participant or Beneficiary elects to receive such distribution in the manner required by the Plan Administrator. For purposes of Section&nbsp;13.02, a distribution elected by a Participant or Beneficiary pursuant to the preceding sentence will not
	be treated as an eligible rollover distribution.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For purposes of this subsection (d), designated Beneficiary means a Beneficiary designated under the terms of the Plan who is an individual and otherwise meets the requirements of Treasury Regulation &#167;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1.401(a)(9)-4.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Time and Manner of Distribution.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT">
<U>
	Required Beginning Date
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Section&nbsp;12.03, the entire
	vested interest of each Participant&#146;s Account will be distributed or begin to be distributed to such Participant not later than the Required Beginning Date. The &#147;Required Beginning Date&#148; for a five percent owner (as defined in section
	416(i) of the Code), is April&nbsp;1 following the calendar year in which he attains age 70
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
	&#8260;
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM">
	2
</SUB>
	, regardless of whether he has terminated from employment with
	the Employer and its Affiliates. For all other Participants the &#147;Required Beginning Date&#148; is April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the Participant either attains age
	70
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&nbsp;1
</SUP>
	&#8260;
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM">
	2
</SUB>
	or terminates employment, whichever is later. No minimum distribution payments will be made to a Participant under the provisions of section 401(a)(9)
	of
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Code while he remains an Employee if the Participant is not a five percent owner as defined above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Death of Participant Before Distributions Begin
</U>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Participant dies before distributions begin, the Participant&#146;s vested interest in his Account will be distributed, or begin to be
	distributed, no later than as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(I)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the Participant&#146;s surviving Spouse is the Participant&#146;s sole designated Beneficiary then, except as provided in subsection (5), distributions to the surviving Spouse will begin by December&nbsp;31 of the
	calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which the Participant died, or by December&nbsp;31 of the calendar year in which the Participant would have attained age 70 1/2 if later.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(II)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the Participant&#146;s surviving Spouse is not the Participant&#146;s sole designated Beneficiary, distributions to the designated Beneficiary will begin by December&nbsp;31 of the calendar year immediately following
	the year in which the Participant died.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(III)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If there is no designated Beneficiary as of September&nbsp;30 of the year following the year of the Participant&#146;s death, the Participant&#146;s entire interest will be distributed by December&nbsp;31 of the
	calendar year containing the fifth anniversary of the Participant&#146;s death.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(IV)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the Participant&#146;s surviving Spouse is the Participant&#146;s sole designated Beneficiary and the surviving Spouse dies after the Participant but before distributions to the surviving Spouse are required to
	begin, this paragraph (B)&nbsp;other than clause (I)&nbsp;will apply as if the surviving Spouse were the Participant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="21%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Form of Distribution
</U>
<I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
	Unless the Participant&#146;s interest is distributed in a single sum on or before the Required Beginning Date, distributions will be made in accordance with subsection
	(3)&nbsp;or (4). If the Participant&#146;s interest is distributed in the form of an annuity purchased from an insurance company, distributions will be made in accordance with the requirements of Code section 401(a)(9) and the regulations
	thereunder.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:11PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Required Minimum Distribution During Participant
</I>
<I>
	&#146;
</I>
<I>
	s Lifetime.
</I>
<I>
</I>
</TD>
</TR>

	.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Participant&#146;s lifetime, the minimum amount that will be distributed for each calendar year is the lesser of:

	&nbsp;

	the quotient obtained by dividing the Participant&#146;s vested account balance by the distribution period in the Uniform
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
